intro: Tagetes imbricata, commonly known as Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which are typically borne in clusters at the ends of its branches. The plant is an annual herb with hairy, linear leaves and a strong, aromatic scent. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Tagetes imbricata is also valued for its ability to repel certain insect pests, contributing to its use in companion planting.
